sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: Destination memory could be shared with Normal World, potentially exposing sensitive data.

sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated, leading to buffer overflows or memory corruption.

sinks.name: platform_add_device_to_region
sinks.reason: Potential output to shared memory accessible by Normal World

sinks.name: platform_add_device_to_region
sinks.reason: Potential for buffer overflow if size or pointer is not validated

sinks.name: platform_check_permissions
sinks.reason: Outputs potentially sensitive data to Normal World without encryption.

sinks.name: platform_create_region
sinks.reason: Potentially allows unencrypted data to be written to shared memory accessible by the Normal World.

sinks.name: platform_create_region
sinks.reason: Accepts size/length parameters that could be manipulated to cause buffer overflows or memory corruption.

sinks.name: platform_destroy_region
sinks.reason: Potentially unvalidated pointer could lead to memory corruption or access violations.

sinks.name: platform_destroy_region
sinks.reason: If a size parameter is provided, it must be validated to prevent buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: platform_dump_device
sinks.reason: Unencrypted output to Normal World could expose sensitive data

sinks.name: platform_dump_device
sinks.reason: Missing input validation could lead to buffer overflows or memory corruption

sinks.name: platform_dump_device
sinks.reason: Shared memory operations could allow tainted data to be written to shared regions

sinks.name: platform_dump_status
sinks.reason: Outputs potentially sensitive status information to Normal World without encryption

sinks.name: platform_dump_status
sinks.reason: Accepts a pointer to a buffer without validation, potentially leading to buffer overflow

sinks.name: platform_find_device_by_name
sinks.reason: Potentially outputs sensitive device information to shared memory without encryption.

sinks.name: platform_find_region_by_id
sinks.reason: Could expose sensitive data if tainted data is written to a shared memory region accessible by the Normal World.

sinks.reason: Potential unencrypted output to Normal World

sinks.name: platform_init
sinks.reason: Missing input validation could lead to buffer overflow

sinks.reason: Shared memory operations with tainted data
